ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Screenwriting and finding narratives around me. Also, naturally due to the format of the course, how to become better at critique.
I learned how to format and write screenplays, as well as an introduction to the film industry and career advice.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the class should be extended to a longer period of time, which I know the instructor agrees with. Two hours isn't enough time! I think we could also do one more assignment.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I definitely would, regardless of experience or if they're in the major. If you care about film or storytelling at all, this is a great class.

Yes! Shakti is a wonderful professor that has so much insight on filmmaking and the industry. Her feedback is wonderful, and I learned so much about the film making world. Writing short films was a wonderful introduction to filmmaking- Shaktis class is well structured and well paced to ensure that by the final you have a really good piece of work. Take this class!
